metadata.title: CVE-2018-10995 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
SchedMD Slurm before 17.02.11 and 17.1x.x before 17.11.7 mishandles usernames (aka user_name fields) and group ids (aka gid fields).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libpmi0 - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libpmi2-0 - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurm-perl - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurm32 - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurmdb-perl - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurmdb32 - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-client - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-client-emulator - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm-emulator - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm-torque - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurmctld - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurmd - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurmdbd - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
sview - 17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.11.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm3').
